p: Expert bodies in the Covid crisis, as argued above, often lacked a clear majoritarian mandate (which should have been provided by legislatures rather than executives) and their role in decision-making was insufficiently transparent and accountable. Expert bodies to play a role in addressing climate change and in developing strategies to combat it will require a stronger democratic mandate, will have to ensure throughput legitimacy and to invite discussion and contestation in order to garner support for their recommendations.
